title: Some friends of mine,
author: Lucas, E. V.
snippet: swarthy, ruddy old man coming jogging (his normal pace) on his well-known mare down the Yarrow by Black Andro (a wooded hill), and past Foulshiels (Mungo Park's birthplace),  after being all night up the glen with some "crying wife," and the cottagers at Glower-ower-'im, blessing him as he passed sound asleep, or possibly wakening him out of his dreams, to come up and "lance" the bairn's eye-tooth.

title: Spare hours...
author: Brown, John
snippet: And Lewinshope still mine shall be; Newark, Foulshiels, and Tinnies baith My bow and arrow purchased m<».

title: Spare hours /
author: Brown, John
snippet: What a pattern of active beneficence, bringing up three sons to his profession, giving his family a first-rate education, and never getting anything for the half of his eveiyday's work !
